page.title: 16Recreation (1)
page.content: In the past , recreational use of the countryside was mostly confined to the rich and powerful . Thus the Bishops of Winchester would use Merdon Castle with its surrounding forests as a lodge for deer-hunting . Although there are still many deer in the area , they are no longer hunted . The huntsmen today pursue foxes and hares . The woods around Merdon Castle ring to a different sort of hunting however - the shooting of pheasant . Use as a game preserve means that the landowner carefully protects the interesting historical remains of the castle from any access by the general public . There is no game shooting on Mr.Race's farm , unlike many of the larger farms in Hampshire , despite the presence of plenty of pheasant and partridge .
